BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownBase`1.SortOrder">
    <summary>
    <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
    <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
    <list type="bullet">
    <item>
    <term>None</term>
    <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>Ascending</term>
    <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>Descending</term>
    <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
    </item>
    </list>
    </summary>
    <value> 
    The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
    </value>
</member>

</member>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SfSkeleton
TagHelpers.Documentation: The Skeleton is a placeholder that animates a shimmer effect to let users know that the page’s content is loading at the moment. In other terms, it simulates the layout of page content while loading the actual content. The `Width` property will be prioritize and used as dimension for Circle and Square . Skeleton with default text shape. ]]> Skeleton with rectangle . ]]> Skeleton with fade effect . ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that defines the width of the Skeleton. Accept the CSS units as string value. The default value is null. The property will be prioritize and used as dimension when is `Circle` and `Square`. Skeleton with `50px` radius applied for . ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Height
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that defines the height of the Skeleton. Accept the CSS units as string value. The default value is null. Not required to define this property when is `Circle` and `Square`. Skeleton with `10px` height applied for . ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Visible
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the visibility state of the Skeleton. true, if the Skeleton is in visible state; otherwise, false. The default value is true. Skeleton rendered with hidden state. ]]>

    </value>
    <remarks>
    If the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SkeletonType"/> is<see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SkeletonType.Circle"/> or<see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SkeletonType.Square"/>, the width property value will be prioritize and used as dimension when <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SfSkeleton.Shape"/> is Circle and Square.
    </remarks>
</member>

    </summary>

The default value is String.Empty. The below code example shows border customization of the Message component. Conference Room no 01 / Building 135 10:00 AM - 10:30 AM ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Severity
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SfMessage.Severity">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the severity of the message, which is used to define the appearance (icons and colors) of the message. The available severity messages are <c>Normal</c>, <c>Info</c>, <c>Success</c>, <c>Warning</c> and <c>Error</c>.
    </summary>
    <value>
    One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.MessageSeverity"/> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.MessageSeverity.Normal"/>
    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowCloseIcon
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SfMessage.ShowCloseIcon">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets whether to show or hide the close icon in the Message component. The end user can click the close icon to hide the message. The <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SfMessage.Closed"/> event triggered when message closed.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c>, the close icon for the Message component is visible at the top right corner of the Message component. The default value is <c>false</c>.
    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowIcon
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SfMessage.ShowIcon">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets whether to show or hide the severity icon in the Message component. When set to true, the severity icon is displayed at the left edge of the Message component.
    This icon will be distinctive based on the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SfMessage.Severity"/> property.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>false</c> hides the severity icon in the Message component. The default value is <c>true</c>.
    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Variant
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SfMessage.Variant">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the variant from predefined appearance variants to display the content of the Message component. The available variants are <c>Text</c>, <c>Outlined</c> and <c>Filled</c>.
    </summary>
    <value>
    One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.MessageVariant"/> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.MessageVariant.Text"/>
    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Visible
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SfMessage.Visible">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the visibility of the Message component. The Message component will be hidden when set to <c>false</c>.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>false</c>, hides the Message component. The default value is <c>true</c>.
    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: VisibleChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:

    </value>
</member>

    Triggers when the Message component is closed (hided) successfully.

    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: AdaptorInstance
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.AdaptorInstance">
    <summary>
    Specifies the custom adaptor class type. DataManager uses this type value to instantiate custom adaptor class.
    </summary>
    <remarks>DataManager uses Activator.CreateInstance method to create custom adaptor instance.
    Injecting services into custom adaptor class, is not supported while using this approach.
    To inject and use services, provide custom adaptor as a Blazor component by extending DataAdaptor class.</remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Adaptor
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.Adaptor">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the data adaptor to be used by <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Data.SfDataManager"/> component.
    <list type="bullet">
    <item>
    <term>BlazorAdaptor</term>
    <description>Default. BlazorAdaptor is used to process Enumerable data. It contains methods to process the given collection based on the queries.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>ODataAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    OData Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData services.
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>ODataV4Adaptor</term>
    <description>
    ODatav4 Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData v4 services
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>WebApiAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    WebApi Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from WebApi services.
    This adaptor is targeted to interact with Web API created using OData endpoint, it is extended from ODataAdaptor
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>UrlAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    URL Adaptor is used when you are required to interact with all kind of remote services to retrieve data.
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>RemoteSaveAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    Remote Save Adaptor is used for binding JSON data.
    It interacts with remote services only for CRUD operations.
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>CustomAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    CustomAdaptor specifies that own data query and manipulation logic has been provided using custom adaptor component
    extended from DataAdaptor class.
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>JsonAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>GraphQLAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    GraphQLAdaptor provides ability to consume and manipulate data from GraphQL services.
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>GraphQLAdaptor</term>
    <description> GraphQLAdaptor provides ability to consume and manipulate data from GraphQL service.
    </description>
    </item>
    </list>
    </summary>
</member>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<member name="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout">
    <summary>
    The DashboardLayout is a grid structured layout component, that helps to create a dashboard with panels.
    Panels hold the UI components or data to be visualized with flexible options like resize, reorder, drag-n-drop, remove and add,
    that allows users to easily place the panels at a desired position within the grid layout.
    </summary>
    <summary>
    Specifies the DashboardLayout component.
    </summary>
    <summary>
    Specifies the DashboardLayout component.
    </summary>
    <summary>
    Specifies the DashboardLayout component.
    </summary>
</member>

    </summary>
    <value>
    Accepts the string value.
    </value>
</member>

    </summary>
    <exclude/>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowDragging
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.AllowDragging">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the DashboardLayout permits the reordering of panels through dragging.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c>, if the drag option can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowFloating
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.AllowFloating">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the DashboardLayout panels must fill the available cells while dragging or resizing.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c>, if the floating option can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
     If <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.AllowFloating" /> is set to true, then the DashboardLayout will automatically move the panels upwards to fill the empty available cells while dragging or resizing the panels.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowResizing
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Layouts.SfDashboardLayout.AllowResizing">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the panels in DashboardLayout can be resized.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c>, if the resizing option can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: CellAspectRatio
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the cell aspect ratio of the panel. A double value that representing the cell aspect ratio of panel in component. The default value is 1. Panel 1 Panel 2 ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: CellSpacing
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the spacing between the panels. An array of double values that defines the spacing between panels of component. The default value is {5, 5}. Panel 1 Panel 2 ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Columns
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that determines the number of columns to be created in the DashboardLayout. Accepts an integer value that representing the number of columns in component. The default value is 1. Panel 1 Panel 2 ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: DraggableHandle
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the draggable handle selector which will act as dragging handler for the panels. You can enable dragging for a particular element of panel using this property. Accepts the string value. Panel 1 Panel 2 ]]>

    <summary>
    Gets or sets whether to persist the component's state between page reloads.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c>, if the persistence can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:

    <summary>
    Gets or sets whether the right to left direction is enabled for the DashboardLayout component.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: MediaQuery
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the media query value where the DashboardLayout becomes stacked layout when the resolution meets. Accepts the string value. The default value is `max-width:600px`. Panel 1 Panel 2 ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ResizableHandles
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the resizing handles directions used for resizing the panels. Resize directions of the DashboardLayout panels. The default resize direction is 'south-east'. Panel 1 Panel 2 ]]>

    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.ChildContent">
    <summary> 
    Gets or sets a value that indicates the child content for the Button including HTML element. If the child content is not specified, button is rendered using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.Content"/> property. 
    </summary> 
    <value> 
    The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
    </value> 
    <remarks> 
    The child content which is specified within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton"/> tag directive is either a string or HTML Element. The string content is also specified using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.Content"/> property. 
    </remarks> 
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.IconPosition">
    <summary> 
    Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display icons in the button. 
    </summary> 
    <value> 
    One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.IconPosition"/> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.IconPosition.Left"/> 
    </value> 
    <remarks> 
    If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Left</c>, the icon will be placed left to the content of the button. 
    If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Right</c>, the icon will be placed right to the content of the button. 
    If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Top</c>, the icon will be placed above the content of the button. 
    If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Bottom</c>, the icon will be placed below the content of the button. 
    </remarks> 
</member>

</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the selector that points to an element in which the FAB will be positioned. The default value is null where FAB is positioned based on viewport of browser. The target element must have relative position, else FAB will get positioned based on the closest element which has relative position. Simple FAB with target. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Visible
BoundAttributes.Documentation:

    <summary> 
    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the FAB is visible or hidden. 
    </summary> 
    <value> 
    <c>true</c>, if the FAB is visible. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
    </value> 
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Position
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfFab.Position">
    <summary> 
    Gets or sets the value that indicates the position of the FAB relative to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfFab.Target"/>. 
    </summary> 
    <value> 
    One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.FabPosition"/> enumeration that specifies the position of FAB. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.FabPosition.BottomRight"/>.
    </value> 
    <remarks>
    To refresh the position of FAB on <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfFab.Target"/> resized, use <see cref="M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfFab.RefreshPositionAsync"/> method. 
    The position will be refreshed automatically when browser resized.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.IconPosition">
    <summary> 
    Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display icons in the button. 
    </summary> 
    <value> 
    One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.IconPosition"/> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.IconPosition.Left"/> 
    </value> 
    <remarks> 
    If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Left</c>, the icon will be placed left to the content of the button. 
    If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Right</c>, the icon will be placed right to the content of the button. 
    If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Top</c>, the icon will be placed above the content of the button. 
    If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Bottom</c>, the icon will be placed below the content of the button. 
    </remarks> 
</member>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfSpeedDial
TagHelpers.Documentation:
The Blazor SpeedDial component that appears in front of all the contents of the page and displays list of action buttons on click which is an extended version of FAB. The button of speed dial is positioned in relative to a view port of browser or . It can display a menu of related actions or a custom content . A simple SpeedDial with action items. ]]> A SpeedDial with popup template.

Feedback Form

Name

Leave Your Comments
]]>

The Blazor SpeedDial component that appears in front of all the contents of the page and displays list of action buttons on click which is an extended version of FAB. The button of speed dial is positioned in relative to a view port of browser or . It can display a menu of related actions or a custom content . A simple SpeedDial with action items. ]]> A SpeedDial with popup template.

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<member name="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager">
    <summary>
    The DataManager is a data management component used for performing data operations in applications.
    It acts as an abstraction for using local data source - IEnumerable and remote data source - web services returning JSON or oData.
    </summary>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: HttpClientInstance
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.HttpClientInstance">
    <summary>
    Specifies the HttpClient instance to be used  by DataManager.
    </summary>
    <remarks>Use HttpClientInstance property to inject named HttpClient into DataManager.</remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Url
BoundAttributes.Documentation:

    <summary>
    Specifies the endpoint URL. DataManager requests this URL when data is needed.
    </summary>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: AdaptorInstance
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.AdaptorInstance">
    <summary>
    Specifies the custom adaptor class type. DataManager uses this type value to instantiate custom adaptor class.
    </summary>
    <remarks>DataManager uses Activator.CreateInstance method to create custom adaptor instance.
    Injecting services into custom adaptor class, is not supported while using this approach.
    To inject and use services, provide custom adaptor as a Blazor component by extending DataAdaptor class.</remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Adaptor
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.Adaptor">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the data adaptor to be used by <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Data.SfDataManager"/> component.
    <list type="bullet">
    <item>
    <term>BlazorAdaptor</term>
    <description>Default. BlazorAdaptor is used to process Enumerable data. It contains methods to process the given collection based on the queries.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>ODataAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    OData Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData services.
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>ODataV4Adaptor</term>
    <description>
    ODatav4 Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData v4 services
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>WebApiAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    WebApi Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from WebApi services.
    This adaptor is targeted to interact with Web API created using OData endpoint, it is extended from ODataAdaptor
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>UrlAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    URL Adaptor is used when you are required to interact with all kind of remote services to retrieve data.
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>RemoteSaveAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    Remote Save Adaptor is used for binding JSON data.
    It interacts with remote services only for CRUD operations.
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>CustomAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    CustomAdaptor specifies that own data query and manipulation logic has been provided using custom adaptor component
    extended from DataAdaptor class.
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>JsonAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>GraphQLAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    GraphQLAdaptor provides ability to consume and manipulate data from GraphQL services.
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>GraphQLAdaptor</term>
    <description> GraphQLAdaptor provides ability to consume and manipulate data from GraphQL service.
    </description>
    </item>
    </list>
    </summary>
</member>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<member name="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager">
    <summary>
    The DataManager is a data management component used for performing data operations in applications.
    It acts as an abstraction for using local data source - IEnumerable and remote data source - web services returning JSON or oData.
    </summary>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: HttpClientInstance
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.HttpClientInstance">
    <summary>
    Specifies the HttpClient instance to be used  by DataManager.
    </summary>
    <remarks>Use HttpClientInstance property to inject named HttpClient into DataManager.</remarks>
</member>

    <summary>
    Specifies the endpoint URL. DataManager requests this URL when data is needed.
    </summary>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: AdaptorInstance
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.AdaptorInstance">
    <summary>
    Specifies the custom adaptor class type. DataManager uses this type value to instantiate custom adaptor class.
    </summary>
    <remarks>DataManager uses Activator.CreateInstance method to create custom adaptor instance.
    Injecting services into custom adaptor class, is not supported while using this approach.
    To inject and use services, provide custom adaptor as a Blazor component by extending DataAdaptor class.</remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Adaptor
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.Adaptor">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the data adaptor to be used by <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Data.SfDataManager"/> component.
    <list type="bullet">
    <item>
    <term>BlazorAdaptor</term>
    <description>Default. BlazorAdaptor is used to process Enumerable data. It contains methods to process the given collection based on the queries.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>ODataAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    OData Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData services.
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>ODataV4Adaptor</term>
    <description>
    ODatav4 Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from OData v4 services
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>WebApiAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    WebApi Adaptor provies ability to consume and manipulate data from WebApi services.
    This adaptor is targeted to interact with Web API created using OData endpoint, it is extended from ODataAdaptor
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>UrlAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    URL Adaptor is used when you are required to interact with all kind of remote services to retrieve data.
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>RemoteSaveAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    Remote Save Adaptor is used for binding JSON data.
    It interacts with remote services only for CRUD operations.
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>CustomAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    CustomAdaptor specifies that own data query and manipulation logic has been provided using custom adaptor component
    extended from DataAdaptor class.
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>JsonAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    JsonAdaptor is used to process JSON data at the client side. It contains methods to process the given JSON data based on the queries.
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>GraphQLAdaptor</term>
    <description>
    GraphQLAdaptor provides ability to consume and manipulate data from GraphQL services.
    </description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>GraphQLAdaptor</term>
    <description> GraphQLAdaptor provides ability to consume and manipulate data from GraphQL service.
    </description>
    </item>
    </list>
    </summary>
</member>

<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DataManager.InsertUrl">
    <summary>
    Specifies the insert URL.
    </summary>
    <remarks>Applicable for remote adaptors.
    When Insert method is called, request will be made to InsertUrl.
    If InsertUrl is not provided, Url is used as fallback.</remarks>
</member>

    Enables offline mode in datamanager.
    </summary>

    Applicable for remote data source. If offline is true then initial request will be made to fetch

    Cached data is stored in the JSON property.
    </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemTemplate

Gets or sets the template used for the visual representation of each item in the . The below code example, showcases a item template in a .

BoundAttributes.Name: GroupBy
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets filed names to display the list in category-wise. Accepts a string value. The default value is String.Empty. @code{ public class Vegetables { public string ID { get; set; } public string Name { get; set; } public string Category { get; set; } } List VegetablesList = new List { new Vegetables { Name = "Cabbage", Category = "Leafy and Salad", ID = "item1" }, new Vegetables { Name = "Chickpea", Category = "Beans", ID = "item2" }, new Vegetables { Name = "Green bean", Category = "Beans", ID = "item4" }, new Vegetables { Name = "Spinach", Category = "Leafy and Salad", ID = "item9" } }; } ]]>

    <summary>
    Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes such as styles, classes, and more that will be applied to the pop-up list element.

</member>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList<TValue, TItem>
TagHelpers.Documentation: The DropDownList component contains a list of predefined values from which a single value can be chosen. Specifies the value type. Specifies the type of SfDropDownList. The DropDownList component contains a list of predefined values from which a single value can be chosen. The DropDownList component allows users to select a single value that is non-editable from a list of predefined values. In the following code example, a basic DropDownList component is initialized with simple list items. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the filtering option is enabled or not. true, if the filtering option is enabled and show the filter bar (search box) in the pop-up; otherwise, false.The default value is false. The filter action retrieves the matched items using the event based on the characters typed in the search textbox.

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.CssClass">

    </value>
</member>

    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for dropdown list component. The default value is <c>false</c>.

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Enabled">
    <summary>
     Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2"/> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.EnablePersistence">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets whether to persist component's state between page reloads. When set to <c>true</c>, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value" /> property is persisted.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    Component's <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value"/> property will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterBarPlaceholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.FilterBarPlaceholder">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the text that is displayed when the filter textbox has no text and removes the focus.
    </summary>
    <value>
    The text that is displayed when the filter text box has no text. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    This property value is updated only when the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.AllowFiltering" /> is enabled.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the floating label behavior of the dropdown list. The text act as a lable. One of the enumeration. The default value is If the FloatLabelType is Never, the placeholder text does not float as a label. If the FloatLabelType is Auto, the placeholder text will float above the DropDownList component as a label after focusing it. If the FloatLabelType is Always, the placeholder text is displayed as a label above the DropDownList component. In the following code example, set the float lable as Auto. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: FooterTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the customised design content and assigns it to the footer container of the pop-up list. The template content. The default value in null. Total list items: 3 @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HeaderTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the customised design content and assigns it to the header container of the popup list. The template content. The default value in null. T-shirt size @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes such as styles, class, and more that will be applied to the dropdown list element. The value as dictionary collection.The default value is null Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; Dictionary CustomAttribute = new Dictionary() { { "title", "Select T-shirt size" } } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.InputAttributes">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes such as disabled, value, and more that will be applied to the dropdown list input element.
    </summary>
    <value>
    The value as dictionary collection. The default value is <c>null</c>
    </value>
    <remarks>
    If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Index
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Index">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the index of the selected item in the dropdown list component.
    </summary>
    <value>
    The index of the selected items in the list. The default value is <c>null</c> which indicates that nothing is selected.
    </value>
    <exception cref="T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException">The index was set to less than -1, or greater than or equal to the number of items on the list at the time the list is rendered.</exception>
    <remarks>
    Use this property to determine the index of the currently selected item in the list if the dropdown list component allows only one selection.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: IndexChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.IndexChanged">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the callback to trigger when the index changes.
    </summary>
    <value>
    An event callback function.
    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Placeholder">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the text that is displayed when the dropdown list has no value and remove on the focus.
    </summary>
    <value>
    The text that is displayed when the dropdown list has no value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    The property depends on the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.FloatLabelType"/> property, The placeholder text acts as a label.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupHeight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.PopupHeight">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the height of the popup list.
    </summary>
    <value>
    The preferred height of the popup list in pixels or percentage of the dropdown list. The default value is <c>300px</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    This property accepts pixels or percentage value.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupWidth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.PopupWidth">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the width of the popup list. By default, the popup width sets based on the width of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2"/> component.
    </summary>
    <value>
    The preferred width of the popup list in pixels or percentage of the dropdown list. The default value is <c>100%</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    This property accepts pixels or percentage value.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Readonly">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2"/> is in read-only mode or not.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c> if the dropdown list is in read-only mode; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default is <c>false</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    In read-only mode, the dropdown list popup can not be opened on click.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowClearButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.ShowClearButton">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show or hide the clear button in the dropdown list. It helps to clear the selected value of a dropdown list on user intraction.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c> if show the clear button in the dropdown list; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default is <c>false</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    When the clear button is clicked, <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value"/>, and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Index"/> properties are reset to null.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableVirtualization
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.EnableVirtualization">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value indicating whether the virtual scrolling is enabled or not.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c> if the virtual scrolling for dropdown list; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default is <c>false</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    To improve performance, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.EnableVirtualization"/> property is set to <c>true</c>. 
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemsCount

    </summary>
    <value>
    The number of list items to be fetched in dropdown list component. The default value is <c>5</c>.

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownBase`1.SortOrder">
    <summary>
    <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
    <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
    <list type="bullet">
    <item>
    <term>None</term>
    <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>Ascending</term>
    <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>Descending</term>
    <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
    </item>
    </list>
    </summary>
    <value> 
    The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
    </value>
</member>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList<TValue, TItem>
TagHelpers.Documentation: The DropDownList component contains a list of predefined values from which a single value can be chosen. Specifies the value type. Specifies the type of SfDropDownList. The DropDownList component contains a list of predefined values from which a single value can be chosen. The DropDownList component allows users to select a single value that is non-editable from a list of predefined values. In the following code example, a basic DropDownList component is initialized with simple list items. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowFiltering
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the filtering option is enabled or not. true, if the filtering option is enabled and show the filter bar (search box) in the pop-up; otherwise, false.The default value is false. The filter action retrieves the matched items using the event based on the characters typed in the search textbox.

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.CssClass">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a CSS class string to customize the appearance of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2"/> component.
    </summary>
    <value>
    Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.EnableRtl">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets whether the right-to-left direction is enabled or not for the drop-down list component.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for dropdown list component. The default value is <c>false</c>.
    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Enabled">
    <summary>
     Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.DropDownListEvents`2"/> component.

    <c>true</c>, if the Dropdown list component is enabled; otherwise, it is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.EnablePersistence">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets whether to persist component's state between page reloads. When set to <c>true</c>, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value" /> property is persisted.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    Component's <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value"/> property will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterBarPlaceholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.FilterBarPlaceholder">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the text that is displayed when the filter textbox has no text and removes the focus.
    </summary>
    <value>
    The text that is displayed when the filter text box has no text. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    This property value is updated only when the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.AllowFiltering" /> is enabled.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the floating label behavior of the dropdown list. The text act as a lable. One of the enumeration. The default value is If the FloatLabelType is Never, the placeholder text does not float as a label. If the FloatLabelType is Auto, the placeholder text will float above the DropDownList component as a label after focusing it. If the FloatLabelType is Always, the placeholder text is displayed as a label above the DropDownList component. In the following code example, set the float lable as Auto. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: FooterTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the customised design content and assigns it to the footer container of the pop-up list. The template content. The default value in null. Total list items: 3 @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HeaderTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the customised design content and assigns it to the header container of the popup list. The template content. The default value in null. T-shirt size @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes such as styles, class, and more that will be applied to the dropdown list element. The value as dictionary collection.The default value is null Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive. @code{ protected List MyList = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; Dictionary CustomAttribute = new Dictionary() { { "title", "Select T-shirt size" } } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.InputAttributes">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes such as disabled, value, and more that will be applied to the dropdown list input element.
    </summary>
    <value>
    The value as dictionary collection. The default value is <c>null</c>
    </value>
    <remarks>
    If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Index
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Index">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the index of the selected item in the dropdown list component.
    </summary>
    <value>
    The index of the selected items in the list. The default value is <c>null</c> which indicates that nothing is selected.
    </value>
    <exception cref="T:System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException">The index was set to less than -1, or greater than or equal to the number of items on the list at the time the list is rendered.</exception>
    <remarks>
    Use this property to determine the index of the currently selected item in the list if the dropdown list component allows only one selection.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: IndexChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.IndexChanged">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the callback to trigger when the index changes.
    </summary>
    <value>
    An event callback function.
    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Placeholder">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the text that is displayed when the dropdown list has no value and remove on the focus.
    </summary>
    <value>
    The text that is displayed when the dropdown list has no value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    The property depends on the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.FloatLabelType"/> property, The placeholder text acts as a label.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupHeight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.PopupHeight">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the height of the popup list.
    </summary>
    <value>
    The preferred height of the popup list in pixels or percentage of the dropdown list. The default value is <c>300px</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    This property accepts pixels or percentage value.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupWidth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.PopupWidth">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the width of the popup list. By default, the popup width sets based on the width of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2"/> component.
    </summary>
    <value>
    The preferred width of the popup list in pixels or percentage of the dropdown list. The default value is <c>100%</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    This property accepts pixels or percentage value.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Readonly">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2"/> is in read-only mode or not.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c> if the dropdown list is in read-only mode; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default is <c>false</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    In read-only mode, the dropdown list popup can not be opened on click.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowClearButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.ShowClearButton">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show or hide the clear button in the dropdown list. It helps to clear the selected value of a dropdown list on user intraction.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c> if show the clear button in the dropdown list; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default is <c>false</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    When the clear button is clicked, <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value"/>, and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Index"/> properties are reset to null.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableVirtualization
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.EnableVirtualization">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value indicating whether the virtual scrolling is enabled or not.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c> if the virtual scrolling for dropdown list; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default is <c>false</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    To improve performance, the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.EnableVirtualization"/> property is set to <c>true</c>. 
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemsCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.ItemsCount">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the number of items to be fetched in the popup when the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.EnableVirtualization"/> property is enabled.
    </summary>
    <value>
    The number of list items to be fetched in dropdown list component. The default value is <c>5</c>.
    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value

<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value">

    </summary>
    <value>
    The value of the selected item in the dropdown list component. The default is <c>null</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    Use the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2.Value"/> property to specify or determine the value displayed in the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownList`2"/> component.

</member>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox<TValue, TItem>
TagHelpers.Documentation: The ListBox component displays a list of items and allows users to select one or more items using a checkbox or keyboard selection. It includes features such as sorting, grouping, reordering, and drag-and-drop functionality for items. The below code example, showcases a component. @code{ private string[] value= new string[] { "List-01"}; private List vehicleData = new List{ new ListItem { Text = "Hennessey Venom", ID = "List-01"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Chiron", ID = "List-02"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Veyron Super Sport", ID = "List-03"} } public class ListItem { public string Text { get; set; } public string ID { get; set; } } } ]]> The ListBox component displays a list of items and allows users to select one or more items using a checkbox or keyboard selection. It includes features such as sorting, grouping, reordering, and drag-and-drop functionality for items. The below code example, showcases a basic . @code{ private string[] value= new string[] { "List-01"}; private List vehicleData = new List{ new ListItem { Text = "Hennessey Venom", ID = "List-01"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Chiron", ID = "List-02"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Veyron Super Sport", ID = "List-03"} } } ]]> The ListBox component displays a list of items and allows users to select one or more items using a checkbox or keyboard selection. It includes features such as sorting, grouping, reordering, and drag-and-drop functionality for items. The below code example, showcases a component. @code{ private string[] value= new string[] { "List-01"}; private List vehicleData = new List{ new ListItem { Text = "Hennessey Venom", ID = "List-01"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Chiron", ID = "List-02"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Veyron Super Sport", ID = "List-03"} } public class ListItem { public string Text { get; set; } public string ID { get; set; } } } ]]> The ListBox component displays a list of items and allows users to select one or more items using a checkbox or keyboard selection. It includes features such as sorting, grouping, reordering, and drag-and-drop functionality for items. The below code example, showcases a ListBox component. @code{ private string[] value= new string[] { "List-01"}; private ListvehicleData = new List{ new ListItem { Text = "Hennessey Venom", ID = "List-01"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Chiron", ID = "List-02"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Veyron Super Sport", ID = "List-03"} } public class ListItem { public string Text { get; set; } public string ID { get; set; } } } ]]> The ListBox component displays a list of items and allows users to select one or more items using a checkbox or keyboard selection. It includes features such as sorting, grouping, reordering, and drag-and-drop functionality for items. The type of the value returned by the selected item. The type of the items in the ListBox. The below code example, showcases a component. @code{ private string[] value= new string[] { "List-01"}; private ListvehicleData = new List{ new ListItem { Text = "Hennessey Venom", ID = "List-01"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Chiron", ID = "List-02"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Veyron Super Sport", ID = "List-03"} } public class ListItem { public string Text { get; set; } public string ID { get; set; } } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2.ChildContent">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value that indicates the child content for the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2"/> including HTML element.
    If the child content is not specified, <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2"/> is rendered using <c>DataSource</c> property.
    </summary>
    <value>
    The RenderFragment content. The default value is <c>null</c>.
    </value>
    <exclude/>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a lambda expression that identifies the bound value of property. The lambda expression that identifies the value bound to the Value property. By using this property and the event, two-way binding can be achieved instead of using @bind-Value. The below code example, showcases a basic . value )" ValueChanged="@((string[] v) => value = v)" DataSource="@vehicleData" TValue="string[]" TItem="ListItem"> @code{ private string[] value= new string[] { "List-01"}; private List vehicleData = new List{ new ListItem { Text = "Hennessey Venom", ID = "List-01"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Chiron", ID = "List-02"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Veyron Super Sport", ID = "List-03"} } public class ListItem { public string Text { get; set; } public string ID { get; set; } } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowDragAndDrop
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2.AllowDragAndDrop">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value indicating whether drag-and-drop functionality is allowed in the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2"/>.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c> if drag-and-drop functionality is allowed; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    The <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2.Scope"/> property is used to perform drag and drop between different <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2"/>.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowFiltering
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2.AllowFiltering">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value indicating whether filtering is allowed in the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2"/>.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c> if filtering is allowed; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    The <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2.FilterBarPlaceholder"/> property is used to show placeholder on the filter bar.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2.CssClass">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the class/multiple classes separated by a space for the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2"/> component. 
    </summary>
    <value>
    The CSS class string to customize the appearance of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2"/>. The default value is an empty string.
    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2.EnableRtl">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control should display in Right-to-Left (RTL) direction.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c> if the control should display in RTL direction; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2.Enabled">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2"/> is enabled to interact with it.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c> if the control is enabled; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2.EnablePersistence">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value indicating whether the component's state should be persisted across postbacks.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c> if the component's state should be persisted; otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    The <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2.Value"/> property is used to persist the component's state.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterBarPlaceholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the placeholder text for the filter bar in the . The string value that represents the placeholder text for the filter bar in the . The default value is an empty string. This property will take into effect once the property is true. The below code example, showcases a filter bar place holder support in the . @code{ private string[] value= new string[] { "List-01"}; private List vehicleData = new List{ new ListItem { Text = "Hennessey Venom", ID = "List-01"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Chiron", ID = "List-02"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Veyron Super Sport", ID = "List-03"} } public class ListItem { public string Text { get; set; } public string ID { get; set; } } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Height
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2.Height">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value that indicates the height of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2"/>.
    </summary>
    <value>
    A string value that represents the height of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2"/>. The default value is "".
    If the value is not specified, then the height will be calculated based on the entire list item's height.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    To add the suffix 'px' to the value if the height is fixed, for instance, '200px'.
    To add the suffix '%' to the value if the height is responsive, for instance, '200%'.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: MaximumSelectionLength
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2.MaximumSelectionLength">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets the maximum length of items that can be selected in the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2"/>.
    </summary>
    <value>
    An integer value that represents the maximum selection length. The default value is <c>500</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    Based on the limitation, list selection will be prevented.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Scope
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that indicates the scope of the . A string value that represents the scope of the . The drag and drop operation and the toolbar interactions performed based on the value. The and is used to enable drag and drop as well as toolbar interactions in the . The below code example, showcases drag and drop support with scope property in the . @code{ private string scope= "combined-list"; private string[] items = new string[] { "MoveUp", "MoveDown", "MoveTo", "MoveFrom", "MoveAllTo", "MoveAllFrom" }; private List vehicleData1 = new List{ new ListItem { Text = "Hennessey Venom", ID = "List-01"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Chiron", ID = "List-02"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Veyron Super Sport", ID = "List-03"} } private List vehicleData2 = new List{ new ListItem { Text = "SSC Ultimate Aero", ID = "List-04" }, new ListItem { Text = "Koenigsegg CCR", ID = "List-05" }, new ListItem { Text = "McLaren F1", ID = "List-06" } } public class ListItem { public string Text { get; set; } public string ID { get; set; } } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownBase`1.SortOrder">
    <summary>
    <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
    <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
    <list type="bullet">
    <item>
    <term>None</term>
    <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>Ascending</term>
    <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>Descending</term>
    <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
    </item>
    </list>
    </summary>
    <value> 
    The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
    </value>
</member>

    <para>It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of `DataManager`.</para>

    </value>
</member>

The below code example, showcases a basic . value )" ValueChanged="@((string[] v) => value = v)" DataSource="@vehicleData" TValue="string[]" TItem="ListItem"> @code{ private string[] value= new string[] { "List-01"}; private List vehicleData = new List{ new ListItem { Text = "Hennessey Venom", ID = "List-01"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Chiron", ID = "List-02"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Veyron Super Sport", ID = "List-03"} } public class ListItem { public string Text { get; set; } public string ID { get; set; } } } ]]>

<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2.AllowDragAndDrop">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value indicating whether drag-and-drop functionality is allowed in the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2"/>.

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterBarPlaceholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the placeholder text for the filter bar in the . The string value that represents the placeholder text for the filter bar in the . The default value is an empty string. This property will take into effect once the property is true. The below code example, showcases a filter bar place holder support in the . @code{ private string[] value= new string[] { "List-01"}; private List vehicleData = new List{ new ListItem { Text = "Hennessey Venom", ID = "List-01"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Chiron", ID = "List-02"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Veyron Super Sport", ID = "List-03"} } public class ListItem { public string Text { get; set; } public string ID { get; set; } } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Height
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2.Height">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value that indicates the height of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2"/>.
    </summary>
    <value>
    A string value that represents the height of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfListBox`2"/>. The default value is "".
    If the value is not specified, then the height will be calculated based on the entire list item's height.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    To add the suffix 'px' to the value if the height is fixed, for instance, '200px'.
    To add the suffix '%' to the value if the height is responsive, for instance, '200%'.
    </remarks>
</member>

    </value>
    <remarks>
    Based on the limitation, list selection will be prevented.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: Scope
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that indicates the scope of the . A string value that represents the scope of the . The drag and drop operation and the toolbar interactions performed based on the value. The and is used to enable drag and drop as well as toolbar interactions in the . The below code example, showcases drag and drop support with scope property in the . @code{ private string scope= "combined-list"; private string[] items = new string[] { "MoveUp", "MoveDown", "MoveTo", "MoveFrom", "MoveAllTo", "MoveAllFrom" }; private List vehicleData1 = new List{ new ListItem { Text = "Hennessey Venom", ID = "List-01"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Chiron", ID = "List-02"}, new ListItem { Text = "Bugatti Veyron Super Sport", ID = "List-03"} } private List vehicleData2 = new List{ new ListItem { Text = "SSC Ultimate Aero", ID = "List-04" }, new ListItem { Text = "Koenigsegg CCR", ID = "List-05" }, new ListItem { Text = "McLaren F1", ID = "List-06" } } public class ListItem { public string Text { get; set; } public string ID { get; set; } } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownBase`1.SortOrder">
    <summary>
    <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
    <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
    <list type="bullet">
    <item>
    <term>None</term>
    <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>Ascending</term>
    <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>Descending</term>
    <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
    </item>
    </list>
    </summary>
    <value> 
    The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableVirtualization
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect`2.EnableVirtualization">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets a value indicating whether virtualization is enabled for the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c> if virtualization is enabled; otherwise, <c>false</c>..
    </value>
    <remarks>
    The Virtual Scrolling feature is used to display a large amount of data that you require without buffering an entire load of huge database records in the DropDowns, that is, when scrolling, the datamanager request is sent to fetch some amount of data from the server dynamically.
    </remarks>
</member>

    <summary>
    Gets or sets the type of floating label to be displayed in the MultiSelect Dropdown component.
    </summary>
    <value>
     Possible values are:
    <c>Never</c>: Never floats the label in the MultiSelect when the placeholder is available.
    <c>Always</c>: The floating label always floats above the MultiSelect.
    <c>Auto</c>: The floating label floats above the MultiSelect after focusing it or when entering the value in it.

<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfDropDownBase`1.SortOrder">
    <summary>
    <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
    <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
    <list type="bullet">
    <item>
    <term>None</term>
    <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>Ascending</term>
    <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
    <term>Descending</term>
    <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
    </item>
    </list>
    </summary>
    <value> 
    The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
    </value>
</member>

    The Virtual Scrolling feature is used to display a large amount of data that you require without buffering an entire load of huge database records in the DropDowns, that is, when scrolling, the datamanager request is sent to fetch some amount of data from the server dynamically.

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention<TItem>
TagHelpers.Documentation:
The component displays a list of suggested items from which users can choose or tag one. Enter the mention character in the editable element and tag the users from the suggestion list. The component displays a list of suggested items from which users can select or tag one. Enter the in the editable element and tag the any item from the suggestion list.
@code{ public class Games { public string ID { get; set; } public string Text { get; set; } } List GamesData = new List { new Games() { ID= "Game1", Text= "American Football" }, new Games() { ID= "Game2", Text= "Badminton" }, new Games() { ID= "Game3", Text= "Basketball" }, new Games() { ID= "Game4", Text= "Cricket" }, new Games() { ID= "Game5", Text= "Football" }, new Games() { ID= "Game6", Text= "Golf" } }; } ]]> Specifies the type of data source. The component displays a list of suggested items from which users can choose or tag one. The selected item inserted in target in a predefined highlight format. Enter the mention character in the editable element and tag the users from the suggestion list.

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the target selector for displaying the component. The SfMention component listens to user input on the target element displays suggestions as soon as the user enters the mention character. This allows users to easily select items from the list of suggestions by typing the mention character and then selecting an item from the list. An element on the page should be used as the target for the SfMention component, so that mention component displays suggestion list opens relative to the elements cursor position. The Target property is required and must be specified.
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

    </value>
    <exclude/>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the class/multiple classes separated by a space for the component. Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include for popup element. The default value is String.Empty.
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: MentionChar
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the symbol or single character which triggers the search action in the component. The SfMention component listens to user input on the element displays suggestions as soon as the user enters the mention character. A character of symbol. By default, the trigger character is the @ symbol..
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowMentionChar
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1.ShowMentionChar">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets whether to show the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1.MentionChar"/> along with with the text when displaying selected mention item in target.
    </summary>
    <value>
    <c>true</c>, the selected mention item displayed along with the mention character. The default value is <c>false</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    If <c>ShowMentionChar</c> is set to <c>true</c>, the <c>mention</c> component will display the mention character along with the text of the mentioned item. 
    For example, if the mention character is <c>@</c> and the user mentions the item "John Doe", the mention will be displayed as @John Doe.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the filter type that specifies the match criteria while searching for mentions. The possible values for the property are: StartsWith lists the items if the start of the text in the item matches with the search term or input string. EndsWith lists the items if the end of the text in the item matches with the search term or input string. Contains lists the items if the item text contains the search term or input string. One of the enumeration that specifies the match criteria while searching. The default value is .
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowSpaces
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<member name="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1.AllowSpaces">
    <summary>
    Gets or sets whether to continue search action if user enter space after mention character while searching.
    </summary>
    <value> 
    <c>true</c>, the search action takes place even after a space, if the DataSource data's are matched. The default value is <c>false</c>.
    </value>
    <remarks>
    By default, the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMention`1"/> component will only search for mentions when the mention character is immediately followed by a non-whitespace character (e.g. @john but not @ john). 
    However, you can change this behavior and allow the SfMention component to continue searching for mentions even if the user enters a space after the mention character by setting the <c>AllowSpaces</c> property to true.
    </remarks>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Name: SuffixText
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the custom suffix that will be appended to the end of the mentioned item's text when it is inserted into the target editor. Accepts as string value. The default value is String.Empty. When a item is selected, the component will automatically insert the text of the mentioned item into the target editor. By default, the mention component will insert the text of the mentioned item without any additional text or characters. However, you can specify a custom suffix that will be appended to the end of the mentioned item's text when it is inserted into the target editor.
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: SuggestionCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the maximum number of items that will be displayed in the suggestion list. The maximum number of items that will be displayed in the suggestion list. The default value is 25. By default, the component will display all of the items in the suggestions list. However, you can limit the number of items that are displayed in the list by setting the property.
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: MinLength
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the minimum length of user input that is required to initiate the search action. The minimum number of characters user input that is required to initiate the search action.The default value is 0. By default, the component will initiate a search as soon as the user begins typing in the editable element. You can change this behavior by setting the property. For example, if you wanted to require the user to enter at least 3 characters before a search is initiated, you could use the following code:
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

    Gets or sets whether to highlight the searched characters on suggestion list items.
    </summary>

    </value>
</member>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the popup's height value in pixels/number/percentage. If a number value is specified, it will be treated as pixels. Accepts property accepts a value in pixels, number, or percentage. The default value is 300px. For example, if you wanted to set the height of the popup to 200 pixels, you could use the following code:
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

The default value is auto. For example, if you wanted to set the width of the popup to 250 pixels, you could use the following code:
@code{ protected List SizeData = new List() { "Small", "Medium", "Large" }; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets a template that defines the appearance of the loading initiator in the popup. This template is displayed until the data for the suggestions has been loaded. The template content. The default value is null.
@code{ public class EmployeeData { public string FirstName { get; set; } public string Country { get; set; } } public EmployeeData Data = new EmployeeData(); public Query Query = new Query(); } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets a template that defines how the selected value will be displayed in the editable component. The TItem" is passed as a context to the template, allowing it to access information about the suggested item, such as its and . The template content. The default value is null.
@@@((context as EmployeeData).FirstName) @code{ public class EmployeeData { public string FirstName { get; set; } public string Country { get; set; } } public EmployeeData Data = new EmployeeData(); public Query Query = new Query(); } ]]>

The SfMention component listens to user input on the target component displays suggestions as soon as the user enters the mention character. This allows users to easily select items from the list of suggestions by typing the mention character and then selecting an item from the list. The template content. The default value is null. is attached to the first element of the TargetComponent.
